definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: In the spring of 480 Xerxes set out from Sardis.
sentences.chinese: 在公元前480年春，薜西斯从萨迪斯出发。

sentences.english: The first wxdye were the Gaels -came about 600 BC.
sentences.chinese: 第一次高潮是约公元前600年盖尔人的来临。

sentences.english: In 771 B. C, the capital was moved eastward to Luoyang in present-day Henan Province.
sentences.chinese: 公元前771年，周的首都东迁到了现河南省的洛阳。

sentences.english: Hannibal defeated the Romans in 216 BC.
sentences.chinese: 汉尼拔于公元前216年打败了罗马军。

sentences.english: By the first century BC the Chinese had developed the technology for deep drilling boreholes.
sentences.chinese: 公元前一世纪，中国人已经发明了深井钻探技术。

sentences.english: As early as 6000 B. C. Dushan Jade has been mined.
sentences.chinese: 早在公元前6000年独山玉就已经被开采。

sentences.english: Bone whistles, used as a type of flute, have been found dating back to 5,000 BC.
sentences.chinese: 用作笛子的骨哨早已出现在公元前5，000年。

sentences.english: In fact, the paintings have been dated back to around 13,000 BC.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，这些油画大约要追溯到公元前一万三千年。

sentences.english: It produces in the B. C. E. , is the human wisdom crystallization.
sentences.chinese: 它产生于公元前，是人类智慧的结晶。

sentences.english: Census figures from the end of the second century B.C. show a population of adult males of around 400, 000.
sentences.chinese: 有数据显示，公元前2世纪有大约40万成年男性。

sentences.english: A Xilang bound Guangzhou Metro Line 1 train departs from Gongyuanqian Station.
sentences.chinese: 往西朗的广州地铁一号线列车开出公元前站。

sentences.english: The most famous version is tantra, which emerged from Asia in about 1400BC.
sentences.chinese: 最出名的应该是公元前1400前在亚洲产生的密教。

sentences.english: The Sphinx was also dated back to 10,500 B. C.
sentences.chinese: 狮身人面像也被追溯至公元前10，500年。

sentences.english: U-en thinks the deer stone is no later than 7th century B. C.
sentences.chinese: 乌恩把鹿石年代下限定在公元前7世纪失之过早。

sentences.english: It is traditionally said to have been founded in 18 BC by the legendary leader Onjo.
sentences.chinese: 据传于公元前18年为传奇人物温祚所建。
“日鼎族”是在公元前500年左右离去的。

definition: the Bronze Age/also written 青銅時代|青铜时代[Qing1 tong2 Shi2 dai4]
the prehistoric Shang dynasty (c. 16th-11th century BC)
Sumer (Šumer), one of the early civilizations of the Ancient Near East
Sassanid Empire of Persia (c. 2nd-7th century AD)
the Spring and Autumn (770-476 BC) and Warring States (475-221 BC) periods

pinyin: Mei3 suo3 bu4 da2 mi3 ya4

definition: Xia or Hsia dynasty c. 2000 BC
